abstract: The best-selling author and public interest lawyer grew up in a home where words mattered. A lot.
lead_paragraph: FREEDOM FIGHTER “Just Mercy” has been in theaters for six weeks, but the book it’s based on has been in the world for six years — including 188 weeks on the paperback nonfiction best-seller list, where it is now No. 1. Bryan Stevenson’s powerful memoir of fighting for the rights of wrongly convicted death row inmates has also made appearances on the hardcover nonfiction list and the young adult list, among others — despite the fact that he wasn’t sold on the idea of writing a book in the first place. (“I wasn’t persuaded a book was a good investment of my time.”)
keywords: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption (Book)
